page_analysis.text_content:
Attic
space &
equivalen-
cies

Voluminous spaces in a
structure contribute to
the mass even if these
areas are not used
or described in the
floor plan. The 2nd &
3rd floor equivalency
addresses how these
areas count toward the
gross floor area.

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

16

Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross
floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

In Fig 11 below, the highlighted areas count as follows:

• Area A of this 3rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head
clearance and counts as 3rd floor area.
• Area B of this 2rd floor (accessible via stairs), has 5' of head
clearance and is included in the count of the, more obvious, 2nd
floor area.

Fig 11 Attic, closet, & perimeter spaces

Note: 500 sf of unusable attic
space may be exempted for
Category 1 & 2 historic homes.

Note:
Measurements are
from top of floor to
underside of the rafter

Underside of
pical)

oor

1st floor

visual_elements.description: A cross-section diagram of a house showing two stories and an attic space. The diagram illustrates different floor levels and head clearance. Key areas are labeled 'A' (in the attic) and 'B' (on the second floor, under a sloped roof section). A vertical measurement of 5' is indicated for head clearance. Stairs are shown leading to the second floor and potentially to the attic. The ground floor is labeled '1st floor'. There are also labels 'CC' and 'oor' which appear to be part of the diagram's internal labeling or possibly truncated text. Arrows point from the top of the floor to the underside of the rafter, illustrating the measurement method.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom right of the page

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum head clearance for counting towards gross floor area
Exempted unusable attic space for historic homes

sections: On all accessible floors, areas with at least 5' of head clearance count toward the gross floor area regardless of the floor plan or actual usage of the space.

Voluminous spaces in a structure contribute to the mass even if these areas are not used or described in the floor plan. The 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency addresses how these areas count toward the gross floor area.
In Fig 11 below, the highlighted areas count as follows:
Note: 500 sf of unusable attic space may be exempted for Category 1 & 2 historic homes.
Note: Measurements are from top of floor to underside of the rafter

additional_notes: The page number '16' is located at the bottom left.
The text 'Underside of pical)' appears to be a truncated label related to the diagram, likely 'Underside of rafter (typical)'.
The text 'oor' near the diagram is likely a truncated label for 'floor'.
The text 'CC' near the stairs in the diagram is unclear in its specific meaning without further context.
